title: A's open 2016 season at Coliseum against Chicago White Sox
content:
For A's fans who have been thinking about next year since May, the team announced its 2016 schedule on Tuesday. Oakland will open at home for the seventh season in a row, with the opposition being the Chicago White Sox on Monday, April 4 at 7:05 p.m.

The A's and White Sox will play a four-game series, then Oakland will head to Seattle for a three-game weekend series against the Mariners. The A's returning home to face the Angels and Kansas City Royals for six games beginning on April 11.

Highlights on next season's schedule include home series against the Chicago Cubs (Aug. 5-7) and Pittsburgh Pirates (July 1-3), and weekend sets against the New York Yankees (May 19-22) and Boston Red Sox (Sept. 2-4).

The A's and Giants will only play four times next season -- two at AT&T Park on June 27-28, followed by two at the Coliseum on June 29-30.
